Sequence Information.Peptide Name: ARs-N (Arenicin-1 analog, Val-rich, synthetic AMPs, 1S=S, UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (73.91%) toArenicin-1R: 23%, V: 27%, Y: 18%.Activity: active against Gram- E.coli ML35p or ATCC 25922 or M15 (MIC 16->16 uM), P-aeruginosa ATCC 27853 or clinical c.i. (MIC >16 uM), A-baumanii c.i.  (MIC >16 uM), Gram+ L. monocytogenes EGD (MIC 8 uM), S-aureus 710A or ATCC 25923 or MRSA ATCC 33591 or clinical c.i. (MIC >16 uM), S-intermidius (MIC >16 uM). This symmetry related changes made the peptide less potent.
Literature Information.Author: Orlov DS, Shamova OV, Eliseev IE, Zharkova MS, Chakchir OB, Antcheva N, Zachariev S, Panteleev PV, Kokryakov VN, Ovchinnikova TV, Tossi A.2019
Literature Information.Title: Redesigning Arenicin-1, an Antimicrobial Peptide from the Marine Polychaeta Arenicola marina, by Strand Rearrangement or Branching, Substitution of Specific Residues, and Backbone Linearization or Cyclization.
